title: Auto lock needs improvement.
text: I really like my August Smart Lock Pro but find limited practicality with the auto lock feature. It locks my door automatically when closed for a set amount of time (or instantly if I so choose.) While this would seem beneficial in making sure I don't forget or when my hands are full, why would I want to risk being locked out when I simply walk outside for a minute? It would be more practical if I could set it for perhaps an hour or so, in case I  forget to lock it when going out for the day, but the maximum setting is only a few minutes. It would, also, be nice to be able to coordinate the function with the auto unlock, since it would seem logical that if I wanted my door to unlock automatically when returning to my home I might want it to lock automatically when leaving it. I had the idea of enabling auto lock when I was in for the evening so that my door wouldn't remain unlocked all night and wouldn't have to lock it behind me when I left in the morning. Unfortunately, when I returned from work the first day, I waited too long to enter my house after the door auto unlocked and it auto locked, again, forcing me to get out my phone to unlock it. Now, if I want to use it that way, I have to rush to get inside before it locks. (Another problem that could be mitigated with longer time settings.)

title: Speaker still on after answering
text:
My doorbell notification chimed and I answered. It was a delivery and when the call was done I hit the X, went back to the home screen on my phone, locked it, and place it on the coffee table. I went out front to pick up my package and I can hear my 6 year old singing along to his cartoons. I thought I was hearing things but it was clearly my child and the tv and it was coming from the doorbell cam. After securing my package, I ran and grabbed my phone. This is a privacy concern and I wanted others to know that your microphone is still on even after going back to the home screen and locking your phone. Force quitting the app seems to be the solution so far. I hope August implements a fix for this because I‚Äôm not okay with people being able to listen in on my family and I.

I‚Äôve had the original doorbell cam when it first came out which has been replaced with the doorbell cam pro when that came out and the original smart lock which has been replaced by the 2nd gen smart lock for years now. This is the first time I‚Äôve ever noticed the mic still transmitting even though the call was ended and the phone locked.

title: DELAYED NOTIFICATIONS!!!  & DEAD BATTS ALL THE TIME
text:
I‚Äôve had the smart lock pro 3rd gen for a couple of years or so, and it started reasonably well. However, about a year ago, it started delivering notifications about the door having been opened or closed about 30 seconds to 3 minutes too late - it was rather annoying knowing that if anyone had broken into my home, I wouldn‚Äôt know about any door opening until about 3 minutes later when the thieves would have likely grabbed what they wanted and ran. 

I complained to company support, whose genius advise was just to delete and reinstall the app, and/or log out and back in - what??? Really??? You can‚Äôt control your own product? Thanks god other products don‚Äôt have this inefficiency built in or people would die. 

Now the latest is that batteries only last 6-8 weeks tops (I use energizer only as they are the best - they come with 1.6 volts and at 1.0 volts, the door locks says battery are only 20% left, but best of all, if you don‚Äôt change them right away, about 8-12 days later the lock will STOP OPENING LEAVING YOU LOCKED OUT OF YOUR OWN HOME - it will refuse to open at this point - ohhhh!! But it will close, so there‚Äôs obviously enough power left. 

This product is so frustrating - no wonder their original door bell was a disaster - I purchased it along with the RING DOOR BELL PRO, and August‚Äôs was a joke vs RING‚Äôs. The door bell would ring but would not capture whoever pressed it - what???? Yes this is August.

title: Limited value for family use
text: I installed the August lock very easily last week. Instructions were clear and everything went smoothly until I tried to add my kids via their Verizon phone numbers. Both kids are on Verizon‚Äôs child plan and August has not figured out a way for users like them to get on the platform with their own accounts and permissions. Instead, for my kids to be able to lock and unlock the door, I had to download the app to their phones and login as me. This means they have full access to all  settings, etc., and also prevents me from getting data on who opened the door and when, etc. The lock is still a big value add for a busy family, I just want people to know that they haven‚Äôt gotten their act together yet when it comes to putting the tool in the hands of young users.

title: Disappointed
text: This is a really cool lock; however, it doesn‚Äôt always Auto Unlock, and when I‚Äôm standing at the door it doesn‚Äôt want to connect to the lock. Sometime when I open the app, it says ‚Äúlock unavailable‚Äù or ‚Äúlock in use‚Äù. Also, I get notification that it‚Äôs disconnected from WiFi and then it reconnects, all within 30-60 seconds. This happens all day long. My WiFi is strong and all my other items are connected just fine to WiFi with no issues. Even my in home cameras work just fine while connected to WiFi and they aren‚Äôt through august. I‚Äôve contacted support and it‚Äôs taking a while to get help. I want to return these locks and get my money back or get them replaced. These are not cheap products. I have the doorbell also and it does the same thing. Also, doesn‚Äôt always allow me the ability to see my live stream. It will close out the app when I click ‚Äúview live stream‚Äù or it will just not connect.

title: Poor support for Apple users.
text:
The lock I bought is fantastic, but I‚Äôm having a big headache trying to get setup complete with HomeKit. First, the app was throwing error ‚Äúobject not found‚Äù when trying to enable HomeKit. When k added the lock to HomeKit manually via the home app, i would get lock and unlock notification, but couldn‚Äôt control the lock from HomeKit. Per the troubleshooting instruction from the august website, it says remove the lock from HomeKit and perform a ‚ÄúHomeKit reset‚Äù which was just a broken URL.

As an alternative to using the home app to control the lock, I looked into using the shortcuts app hoping the developers would support shortcuts to control the lock without opening the app fully. They don‚Äôt support shortcuts.

As a list resort, I was hoping that they might have a widget that would deeplink into the app and toggle the lock. Once again, they don‚Äôt support widgets.

title: Such a great lock! Until...
text: Lock and app have worked great until yesterday, when they failed spectacularly. As I approached my house, I put my phone away. I walked up to the door and tried the door handle to see if Auto-Unlock had worked (it only does about 70% of them time). Tried the keypad. Nada. Looked at my phone and saw an alert about low battery in the keypad and the lock that had not been there just 3 minutes earlier! WTH, August. You only warn me that the battteries are low when they are completely dead and the lock doesn't work at all? Fortunately we had one unlocked window and a ladder. I don't know how we can prevent this from happening in the future other than putting a reminder on our  calendars to recharge the batteries ever 30 days. How magical! And what if they wear down extra fast in a given month? Blech. My husband says they have to fix this within a month or we'll have to switch our lock

title: Works well. Could use two improvements
text: The lock and app work well. The lock syncs with Apple HomeKit. It locks and unlocks quickly and the alerts come reasonably quickly. The app needs one change and could use another. The installation guide on the app has a flaw. It says one should put the adapter into the door. Wrong. The adapter goes into the Smart Lock. Took me an hour to figure that out, with the help of a third-party video. After that it was ten minutes to install. Second, there are times I want alerts and times that I don‚Äôt. The only way to stop them is to delete them. It would be nice if there was a check box next to each alert. Then instead of creating and deleting a new alert each time (each day), one could simply check or uncheck an alert to turn it on or off.

title: Close to Perfect
text:
This lock set up is great. You leave your home and the door automatically locks... When you come home it unlocks. But as many have pointed out, it's not very consistent unlocking when you are near. Either it takes so long you might as well use your keys, or it says it unlocks, but when you go to open your door it's still locked ü§∑üèΩ‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è.

What I want from the app is a button on the home screen, with the lock/unlock button, that will enable/disabled the away/home mode. Going to the community gym or pool or mailbox doesn't activate the away mode so I have dig through the menu to manually activate it, so I can have auto unlock working... Please add that to the home screen and widget.

Overall I still find it useful. Though you can use your apple watch I haven't had much luck as it seems to take three times as long to issue a command.

title: Great with HomeKit
text:
I installed two locks. I was able to easily connect to HomeKit and can not only use Siri to (un)lock, but I‚Äôve set up a schedule to lock both doors at a given time. 
My only problem so far, is I‚Äôve received an automated email stating one of my lock‚Äôs batteries are just about completely depleted. I contacted August since it‚Äôs only been 12 days since installing. They said the notice is erroneous as they see on my account that the voltage is sufficient. 
So, my question is why can‚Äôt I view the battery status on the app?  Especially when they can see it on my account. Other competitors have that. 
For now I was advised there will be an improvement in the battery algorithm in an update coming later this week. Hope it fixes my problem. I‚Äôll update if it does.

title: So far so good
text:
Yes the app has some problems with iOS 13 but after talking with the company there are aware of it. That ok I only used the app to get everything up and running. 

I live in an apartment so I bought the August Home Smart Lock Pro, 3rd Generation, plus Connect. Which is the one that you only replace the inside part of the deadbolt. Since required to have the original lock for the maintenance keys to still work. I love it now when I have my hands full I just tell Siri on my watch to unlock foot no need to put things down to dig for keys. 

I don‚Äôt know why everybody is fussing there no need to open the app after everything is set up. Just use HomeKit to trigger the lock and unlock.

title: Auto unlock radius
text:
Love the concept, but I hate that you can't change the auto-unlock radius. It's fine if I go to class and come back, but I live in a very convenient neighborhood, so every time I go to the grocery store, a restaurant, or walk my dogs, I don't exit the pre-determined radius and auto-unlock isn't engaged. The convenience of auto-unlock is pretty much the whole reason why I got it. That being said, this product only works the way I'd like it to about 30% of the time.

If I'm pulling my phone out of my pocket, unlocking the phone, swiping up to access Home controls, and tapping the unlock icon, then I might as well use my key. I understand that you could customize your radius in previous versions. Can't imagine why August would get rid of that option. Please bring it back and I'll be happy to change my rating.

title: Doesn‚Äôt Function As Advertised
text: Was gifted this lock as a graduation gift. Loved it at first but then noticed that most of the time it wasn‚Äôt syncing with my phone even when I was right next to it. Could never use it and would have to unlock the door with a key. Apparently it doesn‚Äôt work properly unless you have a WiFi bridge? If that‚Äôs the case it should come with this device. But now have to spend another $80 for it to actually work properly. It currently works great if I‚Äôve manually unlocked the door and then been inside the house and logged in but that is pointless if you‚Äôre locked out and need to get in. Currently only thing that works on this device is the manual lock after 60 seconds. Notifications aren‚Äôt even showing up on phone even though I have it set to notify me anytime the door is locked or unlocked either manually or through the app.

title: Another useless update that fixed nothing!
text:
Ever since iOS 15.x this app has been nothing but problem. Now, after new update just came out on November 1 of 2021, it fixes NOTHING! The widget still broken, the Auto Unlock still not working! Did everything they wanted in troubleshooting steps, removed widget, uninstalled the app, restarted the phone‚Ä¶waste of time. Wish I went with another brand of smart locks! USELESS!!!

Thank you for sending us the required information.

We apologize for the delayed response. Due to the current situation, we have experienced a high volume of calls and emails from our customers.

If there is an update or If any additional information is required, we will reach out.

I‚Äôd be out of my job if I‚Äôve sent something like this to my clients or if it took so long to respond, never mind resolve as it probably won‚Äôt happen any time soon if ever.

title: Wish the updates stop breaking functionalities
text: Every other update seems to break existing working functionalities. Now the widget can‚Äôt load. Last update broke the watch app. The update before that cannot control locks that had been working fine. A year ago the state of software was great. I didn‚Äôt have to fish out my phone, navigate to the lock, wait for it to do‚Ä¶ something before being able to operate on the lock. Just two taps on my watch.  It is disappointing that the experience has changed for the worse. Please prioritize the activities people do frequently with keys over everything else: quickly lock and unlock doors. A lock does not seem smart if it takes more than 20 seconds to lock/unlock my door.

title: Used to be a decent app; removing functionality makes me want to invest elsewhere
text:
I only use this for video doorbell purposes. For a long time, the doorbell hardware was lackluster, but a useable app interface made it worth the effort. Then the hardware was improved and i began to think that there was hope - maybe I'd even consider adding locks to my system. Then the app updated and they removed the ability to directly download or share the video recordings without paying subscription fees (in contrast to their own website information). That's a death knell. 

I complained to customer service. I was told that, after researching it further, they determined that there was a bug in the app that "We're currently reporting this issue to our Development Team to fix immediately."  Weeks later, I must assume that their definition of immediately must differ substantially from mine.

title: Getting Buyer‚Äôs Remorse
text: Bought these a month ago. Both front and back door locks began acting up only a few weeks after purchase. I set my auto-lock feature‚Äôs timer to 30 min. It barely hits 2 minutes before either one or both locks are locking the doors while I‚Äôm still home (inside 200 meter range). I try resetting the lock timers and it seems to be hit or miss whether that puts it back on appropriate auto-lock timing or not. My kids are frequently getting locked out of the house because of this flaw. Keypad works 50% of the time as well. ALSO, August seems to be struggling with working alongside Apple TV. Another hit or miss (mostly miss) whether it wants to obey commands from ATV. Maybe that‚Äôs Apple‚Äôs issue but either way I‚Äôm getting fed up with paying so much money for products that aren‚Äôt worth the price. Stop disappointing and FIX these issues August.

title: Not for HomeKit users
text:
This has been a regrettable purchase. I bought the 4th generation lock as it promised HomeKit integration. My only reason for this ‚Äúsmart‚Äù lock is to use a HomeKit automation to turn on the lights on when the door is unlocked. Unfortunately, I‚Äôve been left in the dark one too many times. Sometimes the lights will turn on 20 seconds after unlocking, sometimes not at all. How hard is it to send a simple ‚Äúunlock‚Äù signal over wifi to the HomeKit hub? For August it‚Äôs apparently very difficult. The home app doesn‚Äôt know the status of the lock half the time. 

The app frequently struggles to control the app over wifi. Bluetooth works great, but still doesn‚Äôt send the message to HomeKit most times. Siri can‚Äôt control the lock at all. I‚Äôll be returning this lock and trying something else. Apple should pull the HomeKit license from this product.

title: Good App but...
text: The August app works well independently. I rarely have issues locking or unlocking my door. I will occasionally have to restart my phone in order for it to connect but that is not very often. The areas where I have issues are the quick access options. HomeKit will only work with one device. If I share the home in HomeKit the August lock reads ‚Äúno response‚Äù after being set up. It only works on one phone. I thought I found a way around this by using the August widget but it isn‚Äôt always responsive and I end up going directly to the app. This would be a much better experience if HomeKit or the widget were more reliable.

title: Wish it showed battery life
text:
I recently installed three of these locks. The app works well but I wish it listed battery life so I knew when I should change the battery. This is used in a vacation home and I suspect a surprise dead battery is going to be a problem. Yes I can proactively change batteries before it‚Äôs needed but I consider that a waste and not great for the environment. 

I also think it should do a better job of helping you to troubleshoot. For example, it appeared my hub wasn‚Äôt installed properly, so I kept redoing it but it worked fine after I gave up. My doorsense also isn‚Äôt working so I don‚Äôt understand why the app wouldn‚Äôt notify you, it‚Äôs not recognized instead of claiming to work and not actually function.

title: Very good but more setting would make it great
text: Relatively easy to set up and very happy with this overall. The only thing I can think of that would make it better would be more settings, such as the ability to have a longer timer for the auto lock feature. 30 minutes is good but it would be great to have higher increments like three hours six hours etc. additionally, it would be great to have a feature that auto locks it at a certain time of day or night. I use this for my shed and on any given day I am in and out of there several times. It would be great to be able to unlock this and, In the event that I forget to lock it back, have this automatically lock every day at 6 PM.

title: Please auto-focus on last lock used on app open
text: Just got my August Smart Lock about a week ago, and so far I like it a lot.  The 2 main things on my wishlist are: 1) Have option to OPEN TO THE LAST LOCK USED when the app is launched.  Right now you have to select the home, select the lock, then select lock/unlock.  Should be as simple as opening the app and pressing lock/unlock if you only have one August Smart Lock (similar to how Nest app works).  2) Have OPTION TO TIGHTEN ‚ÄúNEIGHBORHOOD‚Äù RADIUS.  My parents live about a block away, but the auto-unlock feature does not work for them when they go to their home and return to ours.  It would be nice to be able to tighten the home/away detection radius.  Thanks!

title: Do not trust this app and lock
text: Have had the app setup for a few months on an Airbnb and it‚Äôs been the biggest problem of the whole operation. I can‚Äôt even delete users anymore and it sometimes lets me add codes but then randomly they stop working. You are risking your reviews when someone comes in late at night and they can‚Äôt get in and you are already asleep. Tech support will also be of no help. If it‚Äôs a bug in the software they forward to the tech team and say we cant give you an estimate on the number of DAYS until they get back to help you. My experience is you will never hear anything. This leaves you dead in the water and I had to do a 16 hour round trip to just replace this with another product. Maybe the app will work for you, maybe not, but if it doesn‚Äôt you are screwed.

title: The Best Lock and App
text: I‚Äôm not really into the wireless game and technology is not my style. I am plenty satisfied with doing things the old way....however the August lock and app have totally changed my mind. Locking my front door and keeping up with who comes in and out to include times and dates has never been easier. The App and install guide that comes with it allows for the easiest way to get started with securing your home the proper way. I sometimes unlock and lock my house just to see my pit bull Max jump up and stand by the door when he hears the distinct August lock sound.

title: Nice when it works
text:
Like the features of the app, but it‚Äôs so unreliable at least regarding their locks. About once a month I need to delete and reinstall the app because it crashes immediately on open. More frequently it just crashes when trying to change a setting or add a user. And most recently it now goes to a black screen and needs to be force killed every time settings are saved. 

Very hard to rely on something this bad when we‚Äôre away. We now get everything set a couple of days before and then never launch the app again until we‚Äôre home. This after a few weeks ago as we‚Äôre in the car leaving I checked the locks to make sure they were set - and it started a forced upgrade of the front door lock. Which failed and then couldn‚Äôt be accessed any more. 

Locks are fine, app is just ludicrously bad for us.

title: Immediate Feature Request
text: We need an alert for when the lock CANNOT lock or auto lock if the door is barely left ajar.  The system registers the lock as ajar or even closed if it is just slightly open. The lock then try‚Äôs to auto lock and just beeps when it cannot due to the error. You could set an alert to tell you when the door is ajar. However, if only barely open the August magnet registers the lock as closed. This is a security issue as the system registers the lock as closed and the lock physically cannot lock. Please advise. - Other that this issue the system seems rock solid with limited quirks.

title: Software upgrades changes things
text: Those reviews from August 2017 - March 2018 need to be updated. Almost EVERY issue they mention has already fixed with a software update since then. The only issue that remains is the Watch app taking forever to recognize the lock status much less taking action. Thought it was my 1st gen Apple Watch, but apparently the LTE Watch is having the same issue. Regardless, the app is awesome and has spoilt me to no end. I really enjoy asking Siri to check if the front door is locked or to lock/unlock the front door. Keep up the work guys. Small things will definitely get fixed, but the overall experience has been wonderful!

title: Avoid the August doorbell cam at all costs.
text:
Although I have the August door
bell lock, which has had few problems
except eating batteries like crazy, the same cannot be said about the August doorbell camera.  I‚Äôve literally had problems with it since my
first week of ownership.  Here are
just a few:

1). The camera often gets frozen and must be reset on their end.

2). The camera only captures around one third of the people who have been in front of the camera.

3). When you try and view video live, to see who is ringing your doorbell, you frequently get ‚Äúbridge not available‚Äù, and can‚Äôt see who is there.

4). Although cranked to its highest setting, you barely hear the speaker.

5). Speaking of the speaker, you can
not converse with the person on
the other side of door simultaneously ~ it doesn‚Äôt have that ability.

And everything at their headquarters is a recording, you leave a message or wait on hold forever, that is then outsourced to someone throughout the world (mostly Mexico in my case).  

Don‚Äôt believe for a second that these business practices were put into place due to Covid-19.  Their method of operation existed long before the Coronavirus started ravaging the world.

title: Simple UI problems
text: I had bought an August lock when it first came out. The hardware was problematic, got frustrated after a day or two and returned it. Now 2-3 generations later, bough it again, this time the hardware seems to be solid however I am very surprised that there are some really annoying UI problems that should have been fixed by now. First off, I try to change the name of a lock, I type the new name but I can‚Äôt exit. I hit return. It doesn‚Äôt exit, I hit the back button, it doesn‚Äôt go back. I have to shut down the app to get out of the menu item. How could something so simple could be an issue after the app being out so long. I can‚Äôt seem to delete the lock I had bought some years ago. I can‚Äôt change the name of it... so now I have to same named locks...

title: Easy 1-2-3
text: Just had to replace our kitchen door, was looking for new locks and we are a family of six with the problem of not all kids have keys to the door which would always leave the door unlocked, but you know no one leaves with out there phone so August locks was a perfect fit for all of our family. Set up was as easy as it says it is, setting up on the device was as easy as sending them a link to login and done. I do like the that if I'm coming home and my hands are full it will open automatically when I close to my door or can set it to when I'm a 100 feet away

title: Harder than it should be
text:
I now use this app as the primary mode of operation for the only two doors in my house. It takes me about 10 minutes to manually enter a single PIN for either of my locks successfully. Pages and screen in the app just randomly disappear, the app frequently hangs when attempting to update codes on either of the locks. Once this happens I must start the entire process over - often I discover that my changes have been saved several times? Nothing is predictable.  Eventually functional but extremely frustrating process. This app should be significantly more reliable than it currently is. 

All my software is up to date - iOS apps, firmware on locks and bridges, yet it still yields this behavior.

title: Basic functionality perfect; advanced needs some work
text:
If all you‚Äôre looking for is a basic lock that you can operate with your phone august nails it. Never have had a problem of the lock not connecting and opening even through Wifi connector. Has added so much flexibility to my life of letting guests in from a distance if need be. 

The one piece that I desperately need from August is a more robust privileges selection. This all or nothing approach to the advanced features has left me with some awkward instances. Would love the ability to edit features by user to give auto-unlock and guest editing  privileges without giving them access to kick me off the lock.

title: Good to start terrible to transfer
text:
The app is pretty good until it‚Äôs time to upgrade or move it to another device. Currently the icon is not visible on iPhone 13 series. Signing in or resetting passwords doesn‚Äôt work well with iCloud passwords or passwords in general. Only one account can use a phone number and there is no way to create a temporary account for guests. 

I‚Äôve been using this app for several years. The support is abysmal. Chat is a terribly written bot that creates a ticket so it‚Äôs basically very slow email support. Phone support is much the same, long wait times with a really badly setup voice based system that requires several attempts when picking a language or product, sometimes I even have to hang up and call again in order for that system to recognize my selection

title: Needs ability to change status colors
text:
I prefer the color green to indicate closed and locked, red usually indicates something bad, and would be more appropriate for open/unlocked.  It would be nice if you gave the lock owner the option to choose the color scheme they prefer. 

Also on the physical lock itself it would be nice to have some better indication of the locks position,  the almost perfectly round lock body makes it hard tell from a distance.

Otherwise it‚Äôs a stellar lock and service.

title: Lock and widget are slow to recognize proximity to door and inputs
text:
Approaching my front door with the smart lock connected through the bridge is unpredictable with results.  Sometimes it opens on its own with me 30 feet from the front door, other times it doesn‚Äôt recognize I‚Äôm there standing at the door and I have to pull up the august app to unlock the door.  The ios14 widget sometimes doesn‚Äôt recognize button pushes for locking/unlocking the door also.  

I‚Äôm on latest firmware, app is up to date, phone is up to date and yes... I‚Äôve tried to restart the phone.  Same results.  If I stand there by the door and don‚Äôt open my phone, it can sometimes take up to 20 seconds for the door to finally unlock.  What gives?

title: The August Lock
text:
I like the app. It‚Äôs very helpful when I am just getting home from school. It‚Äôs less pressure to remember to grab a little tiny key, when you could just pull your phone out of your pocket to unlock it! There was a little issue... the app doesn‚Äôt load if you aren‚Äôt in at least in a three mile radius of the lock. I found it a little bad that, in this senecio, there was a package that was delivered. You were out of town. You tell your friend to put it in your house for you, but, you are unable to unlock it. I would like it better if it was able to unlock from further away. 

             -R. F.

title: Disappointing software, nice hardware
text: I purchased 3 August locks and the actual locks are well designed. The software is another story. The app is mediocre at best. Unfortunately, it does not work with HomeKit as advertised. Yes, you can successfully add it to HomeKit, but it only works half the time if I‚Äôm lucky. Which leaves me using the lackluster app. Since HomeKit wasn‚Äôt working, I decided to try the geofencing option in the August app, but you can only enable it for one lock. You also can‚Äôt use shortcuts or widgets for easy access to lock/unlock your doors. I‚Äôm definitely regretting my purchase. I‚Äôd recommend looking at some of the less aesthetically pleasing locks that actually work with HomeKit and have a robust app to support them.

title: I used to love it - but app broken for 3 months!
text: I have now been using for about five years the Apple door lock the Apple keypad and the Apple doorbell camera. I would have given them a rating of five stars three months ago. However, my app has been crashing now for three months in a row. I cannot turn off the doorbell. I cannot mute notifications. I cannot open the door remotely. When the doorbell rings, I cannot turn off the sound when I answer the door. I have been talking to August support every two weeks, and they still have not fixed anything. The call-center for August support is not home by August. It is an outsourced call-center. There is no way to reach anyone at August it appears now. I hope they read this rating and get back to me.

title: Works well
text: Surprisingly this works very well. Haven't had any problems thus far. It auto unlocks when I arrive about 95% of the time. Rarely have to use the key. My phone rarely fails to find the lock from the app even when I'm away from home. I have a wifi bridge for the lock that is positioned 19 feet from the door with the lock and it has good signal strength despite being further away than recommended. Overall impressed with the technology. Maybe I'm a pessimist but despite the cost I was expecting to have more problems than this. Well designed.

title: Great except for speed
text: We have two August locks. One is the original edition and the other is a later edition. We love what the lock offers for security and information about who is coming in and out. The only issue is the time it takes to open the door. Most times we would be able to open the door more quickly with a key. Even though we have it on Auto Unlock when we come back to our home, we often have to wait in front of the door a long time before it connects to our iPhone or Apple Watch. It eventually does but a speed improvement would make it a better lock.

title: Works as expected after rough start
text: I purchased the non-pro model because to me it looks better. Anyway, the first lock I bought had a ‚Äúknown issue‚Äù where the batteries would only last one day. I contacted August customer service and they replaced my lock very quickly for a version that does not have the battery issue and it has been smooth sailing ever since. I still gave the lock a 5 star rating because things happen in life but sometimes it how you respond that determines your character as a person and as a company.

title: Disappointed
text: Have had August for over 5 years. Works about 25% of the time to unlock. At home, it locks with no problem and when we leave no issues, but upon returning it does not unlock all the time. 75% of the time, the app is ‚Äúconnecting ‚Äú and can take up to 1 Minute to unlock. Rest of the time I have to repair the connection. My wife also has the same problems. App feature no better. Customer service has nothing to offer. Been looking to replace but need money due to virus. Sorry I ever bought this lock, maybe it‚Äôs to old and bought when it first came out but that should not affect the opening of the door. Router and phones are new so that shouldn‚Äôt be an issue.

title: App works well
text: Love being able to unlock remotely. The app works well and is pretty easy to use and setup. Maybe I haven‚Äôt found a way to do this but if there were improvements needed then I would suggest ways to be able to default navigate to a house in a keychain. I shouldn‚Äôt need to click on a house in the keychain everytime it should just navigate to it automatically. Also, in the iOS widget, you need to indicate the current state of the lock.  It does show after you press the lock/unlock buttons but would be helpful if it shows it all the time.

title: Could be 5 stars
text:
